segment.source: Learn about the differences between the AdControl class in the Microsoft advertising libraries and the AdMediatorControl class in the ad mediation libraries.
segment.target: Learn about the differences between the AdControl class in the Microsoft advertising libraries and the AdMediatorControl class in the ad mediation libraries.

segment.source: What is the difference - AdMediatorControl or AdControl
segment.target: What is the difference - AdMediatorControl or AdControl

segment.source: What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl
segment.target: What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: Use the Microsoft advertising libraries for XAML and JavaScript in your app when you want to display banner ads or video interstitial ads from Microsoft.
segment.target: Use the Microsoft advertising libraries for XAML and JavaScript in your app when you want to display banner ads or video interstitial ads from Microsoft.

segment.source: These libraries are different than the ad mediation libraries, which you use to display ads from multiple ad networks.
segment.target: These libraries are different than the ad mediation libraries, which you use to display ads from multiple ad networks.

segment.source: Use this documentation for the Microsoft advertising libraries (XAML and JavaScript) when:
segment.target: Use this documentation for the Microsoft advertising libraries (XAML and JavaScript) when:

segment.source: You are using AdControl or InterstitialAd in a XAML or JavaScript app rather than AdMediatorControl.
segment.target: You are using AdControl or InterstitialAd in a XAML or JavaScript app rather than AdMediatorControl.

segment.source: You are looking for reference information for the underlying AdControl API used by ad mediation.
segment.target: You are looking for reference information for the underlying AdControl API used by ad mediation.

segment.source: The Microsoft advertising libraries and the ad mediation libraries are both included in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: The Microsoft advertising libraries and the ad mediation libraries are both included in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: For more information about installing this SDK and the different Microsoft advertising libraries that are included in this SDK, see Install the Microsoft advertising libraries.
segment.target: For more information about installing this SDK and the different Microsoft advertising libraries that are included in this SDK, see Install the Microsoft advertising libraries.

segment.source: Note To show interstitial ads, use the InterstitialAd control.
segment.target: Note To show interstitial ads, use the InterstitialAd control.

segment.source: The AdControl and AdMediatorControl cannot show interstitial ads.
segment.target: The AdControl and AdMediatorControl cannot show interstitial ads.

segment.source: For more information, see Interstitial ads.
segment.target: For more information, see Interstitial ads.

segment.source: Ad mediation
segment.target: Ad mediation

segment.source: The recommended way to show banner ads from Microsoft (not interstitial ads) is to use the AdMediatorControl in your app.
segment.target: The recommended way to show banner ads from Microsoft (not interstitial ads) is to use the AdMediatorControl in your app.

segment.source: The AdMediatorControl shows banner ads from multiple advertising networks.
segment.target: The AdMediatorControl shows banner ads from multiple advertising networks.

segment.source: When you use the AdMediatorControl in a project, you must specify which ad networks to use using the Connected Services feature of Visual Studio.
segment.target: When you use the AdMediatorControl in a project, you must specify which ad networks to use using the Connected Services feature of Visual Studio.

segment.source: Visual Studio will attempt to fetch the required assemblies programmatically for some ad networks.
segment.target: Visual Studio will attempt to fetch the required assemblies programmatically for some ad networks.

segment.source: If there are any assemblies that cannot be automatically retrieved, you must install them for each ad network.
segment.target: If there are any assemblies that cannot be automatically retrieved, you must install them for each ad network.

segment.source: For more information about ad mediation, see Use ad mediation to maximize revenue.
segment.target: For more information about ad mediation, see Use ad mediation to maximize revenue.

segment.source: The AdMediatorControl abstracts away the use of ad unit ids and application ids.
segment.target: The AdMediatorControl abstracts away the use of ad unit ids and application ids.

segment.source: Those ids are managed by the AdMediatorControl, in conjunction with your ad mediation settings in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Those ids are managed by the AdMediatorControl, in conjunction with your ad mediation settings in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: For more information, see Submit your app and configure ad mediation.
segment.target: For more information, see Submit your app and configure ad mediation.

segment.source: The AdMediatorControl supports the APIs for each of the advertising services it mediates using its own attributes and syntax.
segment.target: The AdMediatorControl supports the APIs for each of the advertising services it mediates using its own attributes and syntax.

segment.source: For more information, see Add and use the ad mediator control.
segment.target: For more information, see Add and use the ad mediator control.

segment.source: AdControl
segment.target: AdControl

segment.source: If you only want to display banner ads from Microsoft (no other ad networks), you can use AdControl by itself in XAML and JavaScript apps.
segment.target: If you only want to display banner ads from Microsoft (no other ad networks), you can use AdControl by itself in XAML and JavaScript apps.

segment.source: While testing an app that uses the AdControl, use the Test mode values for the application ID and ad unit ID.
segment.target: While testing an app that uses the AdControl, use the Test mode values for the application ID and ad unit ID.

segment.source: After you have finished testing your app and you are ready to submit it to Windows Dev Center, use the Windows Dev Center dashboard to get your live ad unit ID and application ID and update your code to use these values.
segment.target: After you have finished testing your app and you are ready to submit it to Windows Dev Center, use the Windows Dev Center dashboard to get your live ad unit ID and application ID and update your code to use these values.

segment.source: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
segment.target: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
